docs.title: IFC Processing API Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the IFC Processing API documentation. This API provides a comprehensive set of endpoints for processing and analyzing IFC (Industry Foundation Classes) files.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🔍 IFC File Processing: Process IFC files using IfcOpenShell
  • 📊 Element Extraction: Get detailed information about building elements
  • 🏢 Model Splitting: Split IFC files by storey
  • 📏 Unit Conversion: Automatic conversion to consistent units
  • 🔄 Async Processing: Support for asynchronous processing with callbacks
  • 🔒 Secure: API key authentication and secure file handling

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API requests require an API key in the X-API-Key header:

curl -H "X-API-Key: your-api-key" https://api.example.com/api/ifc/process

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
1. Process an IFC file:
curl -X POST https://api.example.com/api/ifc/process \
  -H "X-API-Key: your-api-key" \
  -F "file=@path/to/your/file.ifc"
  1. Extract building elements with callback:
curl -X POST https://api.example.com/api/ifc/extract-building-elements \
  -H "X-API-Key: your-api-key" \
  -F "file=@path/to/your/file.ifc" \
  -F 'callback_config={"url": "https://your-callback-url.com/webhook", "token": "your-token"}'

docs.title: Async Processing with Callbacks
docs.text:
For large IFC files, you can use the callback functionality to process files asynchronously:

  1. Submit a request with a callback URL
  2. Receive immediate response with task ID
  3. Get progress updates at your callback URL
  4. Receive final results when processing is complete

Example callback data:

{
  "status": "processing",
  "progress": 50,
  "total_elements": 1000,
  "processed_elements": 500
}

docs.title: API Endpoints
docs.text:
• /api/ifc/process: Basic IFC file processing
  • /api/ifc/extract-building-elements: Extract detailed element information
  • /api/ifc/split-by-storey: Split IFC model by building storeys
  • /api/ifc/property-values: Extract specific property values
  • /api/ifc/elements-info: Get element information
  • /api/ifc/geometry: Process geometry information

See the API Reference for detailed endpoint documentation.

docs.title: Security
docs.text: We take security seriously. Learn about our security measures in the Security Guide.

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For support, please:

  1. Check the API Reference
  2. Review common issues in our documentation
  3. Contact support with detailed error information

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text:
• 100 requests per minute per API key
  • Maximum file size: 100MB
  • Callback timeout: 300 seconds

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This document provides detailed information about the available API endpoints and their usage.

docs.title: Process IFC File
docs.text:
POST /api/ifc/process

Process an IFC file and stream the results. The response is streamed as newline-delimited JSON (NDJSON).

Request

  • Content-Type: multipart/form-data
  • Body:
  • file: IFC file (required)

Response

  • Status: 200 OK
  • Content-Type: application/x-ndjson

Progress updates during processing:

{
  "status": "processing",
  "progress": 45.5,
  "processed": 455,
  "total": 1000
}

Final response:

{
  "status": "complete",
  "elements": [
    {
      "id": "2O2Fr$t4X7Zf8NOew3FNr2",
      "type": "IFCWALL",
      "properties": {
        "name": "Basic Wall:Interior - 165 Partition (92mm Stud):261516",
        "level": "Level 1"
      },
      "volume": 12.5,
      "area": 25.0,
      "dimensions": {
        "length": 5.0,
        "width": 0.2,
        "height": 3.0
      },
      "materials": ["Concrete", "Steel"],
      "material_volumes": {
        "Concrete": {
          "volume": 10.5,
          "fraction": 0.84
        },
        "Steel": {
          "volume": 2.0,
          "fraction": 0.16
        }
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Split IFC by Storey
docs.text:
POST /api/ifc/split-by-storey

Split an IFC file by building storey and return the results as a zip file.

Request

  • Content-Type: multipart/form-data
  • Body:
  • file: IFC file (required)

Response

  • Status: 200 OK
  • Content-Type: application/zip
  • Body: ZIP file containing the split IFC files

docs.title: Extract Building Elements
docs.text:
POST /api/ifc/extract-building-elements

Extracts comprehensive information about building elements including properties, quantities, materials, and their relationships.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Paginated results for large models
  • Optional filtering by IFC classes
  • Consistent unit system (metric)
  • Complete material layering information
  • Accurate quantity calculations
  • Common property extraction
  • Asynchronous processing with callbacks

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
• X-API-Key: Your API key (required)
  • Accept: application/json

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Name Type Required Description file File Yes IFC file to process page Integer No Page number (default: 1) page_size Integer No Items per page (default: 50, max: 10000) filtered_classes Array[String] No List of IFC classes to include exclude_properties Boolean No Exclude element properties exclude_quantities Boolean No Exclude quantities exclude_materials Boolean No Exclude material information exclude_width Boolean No Exclude material widths exclude_constituent_volumes Boolean No Exclude constituent volumes callback_config Object No Callback configuration for async processing

docs.title: Callback Configuration
docs.text:
{
  "url": "https://your-callback-url.com/webhook",
  "token": "your-callback-token"
}

When callback_config is provided:

  1. The endpoint returns immediately with a task ID
  2. Progress updates (every 10%) are sent to the callback URL
  3. Final results are sent to the callback URL
  4. All callback requests include the provided token in the Authorization header

docs.title: Progress Update
docs.text:
{
  "status": "processing",
  "progress": 10,
  "total_elements": 100,
  "processed_elements": 10
}

docs.title: Final Result
docs.text:
{
  "status": "completed",
  "progress": 100,
  "result": {
    "metadata": {
      "total_elements": 100,
      "total_pages": 2,
      "current_page": 1,
      "page_size": 50,
      "ifc_classes": ["IfcWall", "IfcDoor"],
      "units": {
        "length": "METRE",
        "area": "SQUARE_METRE",
        "volume": "CUBIC_METRE"
      }
    },
    "elements": [
      {
        "id": "3DqaUydM99ehywE4_2hm1u",
        "ifc_class": "IfcWall",
        "object_type": "Basic Wall:Holz Aussenwand_470mm",
        "properties": {
          "loadBearing": true,
          "isExternal": true
        },
        "quantities": {
          "volume": {
            "net": 31.90906,
            "gross": 32.38024
          },
          "area": {
            "net": 68.89412,
            "gross": 68.89412
          },
          "dimensions": {
            "length": 19.684,
            "width": 0.47,
            "height": 3.5
          }
        },
        "materials": ["_Holz_wg", "_Staenderkonstruktion_ungedaemmt_wg"],
        "material_volumes": {
          "_Holz_wg": {
            "fraction": 0.04255,
            "volume": 1.35783,
            "width": 0.02
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Error Response
docs.text:
{
  "status": "error",
  "error": "Error message details"
}

docs.title: Initial Response (with callback)
docs.text:
{
  "task_id": "12345678-1234-5678-1234-567812345678",
  "message": "Processing started. Results will be sent to callback URL."
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text: Status Code Description 400 Invalid request parameters 401 Invalid or missing API key 413 File too large 422 Invalid callback configuration 500 Server error

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API endpoints require authentication using an API key. Include the key in the request headers:

X-API-Key: your-api-key-here

Requests without a valid API key will receive a 401 Unauthorized response.

Note: The API documentation at /docs is publicly accessible, but you'll need to provide an API key to test the endpoints.

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text: All endpoints may return the following error responses:

docs.title: 400 Bad Request
docs.text:
{
  "detail": "Error message describing the issue"
}

docs.title: 500 Internal Server Error
docs.text:
{
  "detail": "Internal server error occurred"
}

docs.title: File Size Limits
docs.text: • Maximum IFC file size: 100MB

docs.title: Data Handling
docs.text:
We take data privacy seriously:

  • 🗑️ All uploaded files are automatically deleted after processing is complete
  • 🧹 Temporary files are completely wiped from container storage every hour
  • 🔒 Files are processed with minimal disk persistence
  • 📝 Processing logs are kept only for debugging and are regularly purged
  • 🔐 All API requests require authentication via API key

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API endpoints require authentication using an API key. Include the key in the request headers:

X-API-Key: your-api-key-here

Requests without a valid API key will receive a 401 Unauthorized response.

docs.title: File Size Limits
docs.text: • Maximum IFC file size: 100MB
